Class Processor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ArrayBoundedStack<java.lang.Short>
      • Processor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    StackInterface<java.lang.Short>

    public class Processor
extends ArrayBoundedStack<java.lang.Short>
    Processor.java Processor is a stack, derived from the ArrayBoundedStack.
    Author:
    Andy Kim 3/2/2017

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Processor()
      Constructs int array, stk and sets all condition flags to false.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add()
      removes the top two numbers from the stack, adds them, and pushes the result
      boolean crash()
      true if the last instruction causes a StackOverflow or StackUnderflow exception
      void divide()
      removes the top two numbers on the stack, integer divides them, and pushes the result
      boolean isEmpty()
      returns whether stack is empty
      boolean isFull()
      returns whether stack is full
      void multiply()
      removes the top two numbers from the stack, multiplies them, and pushes the result
      boolean negate()
      true if the last instruction resulted in a negative number
      boolean overflow()
      true if the last instruction resulted in a number that can't be represented properly in 16 bits
      void pop()
      removes a number from the top of stack (the number is lost)
      void push(int n)
      Pushes a number onto the stack
      int read()
      returns the number on the top of the stack
      void subtract()
      removes the top two numbers from the stack, subtracts them, and pushes the result
      boolean zero()
      return true if the last instruction executed leaves a 0 on top of the stack
